--- title: "Statistical Concepts" author: "Yazan Dabbas" date: "12/12/2023" format: html: code-line-numbers: true df-print: paged --- **Load the Data ** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_4ecff5818ab7f1159658027470ca1b59'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load the data df <- readRDS("C:/Master Degree/Core Qualification_Compulsory Courses/Business/Causal_Data_Science/Data/Causal_Data_Science_Data/random_vars.rds") # Be familiar with the data head(df) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: **Get an Overview of the Data ** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_44358895443c0a53968de975d345d6fa'} ```{.r .cell-code} View(df) ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_530bae9047c532948cfea4ecc513e310'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Store columns in variables age <- df$age income <- df$income # 1) ``` ::: **a) Calculate the Expected Value ** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_b3b90e32f823ed2b81550c4b6a6308ee'} ```{.r .cell-code} expected_age <- sum(age) / length(age) expected_income <- sum(income) / length(income) cat("Expected age is ", expected_age, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Expected age is 33.471 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("Expected income is ", expected_income, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Expected income is 3510.731 ``` ::: ::: **b) Calculate the Variance ** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_b4ee51773615746366934c97748a44d5'} ```{.r .cell-code} mean_age <- mean(age) mean_income <- mean(income) variance_age <- sum((age - mean_age)^2) / (length(age) - 1) variance_income <- sum((income - mean_income)^2) / (length(income) - 1) cat("Age Variance is ", variance_age, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Age Variance is 340.6078 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("Income Variance is ", variance_income, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Income Variance is 8625646 ``` ::: ::: **c) Calculate the Standard Deviation ** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_39d16a088f37e4b754e495585bf42ca8'} ```{.r .cell-code} SD_age <- sqrt(variance_age) SD_income <- sqrt(variance_income) cat("SD of Age is ", SD_age, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> SD of Age is 18.45556 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("SD of Income is ", SD_income, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> SD of Income is 2936.945 ``` ::: ::: **2) Standard Deviation Comparison** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.callout-important appearance="minimal"} - **When the variables are measured in the same units and have similar scales, comparing standard deviations directly is most useful.** - **In the instance of age and income, the variables have distinct units and scales. As a result, directly comparing their standard deviations may not yield relevant insights.** ::: **3) The Relationship Between Covariance and Correlation** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_cbecd9d339e9fcc3b8e0a2af02347bb9'} ```{.r .cell-code} covariance_value <- sum((age - mean_age) * (income - mean_income)) /length(age) cat("Covariance Value:", covariance_value, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Covariance Value: 29670.45 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} correlation_value <- covariance_value / (SD_age * SD_income) cat("Correlation Value:", correlation_value, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Correlation Value: 0.5473952 ``` ::: ::: **4) Interpretation regarding the Relationship Between Covariance and Correlation** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.callout-important appearance="minimal"} - **The standardized scale of the correlation coefficient makes comparison easier. The fact that it goes from `-1` to `1` gives for a clear grasp of the relationship's strength and direction.** ::: **5) Compute the Conditional Expected Value for:** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_04f452cc545cba6e8fa1d3c1e7f19848'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 1. E[income|age<=18] subset_1 <- df %>% filter(age <= 18) conditional_expected_value1 <- mean(subset_1$income) cat("Conditional Expected Value of Income for age <= 18:", conditional_expected_value1, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Conditional Expected Value of Income for age <= 18: 389.6074 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # 2. E[income|age<=[18,65)] subset_2 <- df %>% filter(age >= 18 & age < 65) conditional_expected_value2 <- mean(subset_2$income) cat("Conditional Expected Value of Income for age in [18, 65):", conditional_expected_value2, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Conditional Expected Value of Income for age in [18, 65): 4685.734 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #3. E[income|age>=65] subset_3 <- df %>% filter(age >= 65) conditional_expected_value3 <- mean(subset_3$income) cat("Conditional Expected Value of Income for age >= 65:", conditional_expected_value3, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Conditional Expected Value of Income for age >= 65: 1777.237 ``` ::: :::
